snippet: Tobacco companies are using trade and investment agreements to challenge and intimidate developing countries as they try to regulate cigarettes.
abstract: Editorial criticizes tobacco companies for using trade and investment agreements to challenge and intimidate developing countries that are trying to regulate cigarettes; urges all nations to follow example of the United States and 11 Pacific Rim countries in including safeguards in trade and investment agreements that protect nations from legal challenges by tobacco companies.
lead_paragraph: Tobacco companies are using trade and investment agreements to challenge and intimidate developing countries as they try to regulate cigarettes.
